com.xceptance.xlt.nocoding.util

Class FileFinderUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.nocoding.util.FileFinderUtils

  • public class FileFinderUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for verifying if a file exists and getting an existing file from a list of Strings.
    Author:
    ckeiner

    • Method Detail

      • getExistingFilepath

        public static java.lang.String getExistingFilepath(java.util.List<java.lang.String> possiblePaths)
                                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Goes through all provided file paths and tries to find a path to an existing file. If the extension is missing, it adds all known extensions via ParserFactory.getExtensions() and searches for the file.
        Parameters:
        possiblePaths - All possible filepaths to look into, with or without file extension
        Returns:
        The path to a found file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if no existing file could be found

      • existsFileFor

        public static boolean existsFileFor(java.lang.String fullPath)
        Checks if at the location of fullPath anything can be found.
        At first, it creates a file at the path and if it exists, the function returns true. If no File exists, it creates a URL and tries to open the Stream. If the Stream can be opened, then we can read from there and return true.
        Parameters:
        fullPath - The path to the file, with the file extension
        Returns:
        True if either a File or URL can read from the provided fullPath
